cards.back: Right shift (delay) by 3 units. The signal starts 3 time units later. Subtracting from t delays the signal.
Left shift (advance) by 2 units. The signal starts 2 time units earlier. Adding to t advances the signal.
Compresses the signal horizontally by factor 2. Events happen twice as fast. Multiply t by a>1 to compress.
Stretches the signal horizontally by factor 2. Events happen twice as slow. Multiply t by a<1 to stretch.
Time reversal. Reflects the signal about t=0. Past becomes future. The signal plays backwards.
Amplitude inversion. Reflects about the t-axis. Positive values become negative. Not to be confused with x(-t).
Rewrite as x(2(t-2)). First scale by 2 (compress), then shift by 2 (not 4!). Shift value is divided by scale factor.

x(t) = x(-t)
Symmetric about t=0. Examples: cos(t), t², constants. Mirror image across vertical axis.

x(t) = -x(-t)
Anti-symmetric about origin. Examples: sin(t), t³, t. x(0) must equal 0.

Any signal x(t) = xₑ(t) + xₒ(t)
xₑ = [x(t)+x(-t)]/2
xₒ = [x(t)-x(-t)]/2
